item.title: 新新加坡 "战略为日兴 AM 指数带来 20% 的超额回报
item.description: 表现第二好的新加坡基金以蓝筹股为目标，这些股票的长期表现有可能超过新加坡基准指数。【原文：The second-best-performing Singapore fund targets blue-chip stocks with potential to outperform the city-state’s benchmark index over the long term.】

item.title: 特朗普当选几率下降，比特币冲向纪录高点的步伐受阻
item.description: 随着支持加密货币的共和党提名人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在博彩市场上的当选赔率下降，比特币冲击历史最高点的势头正在减弱。【原文：Bitcoin’s push toward a record high is fizzling as pro-crypto Republican nominee Donald Trump’s election odds drop in betting markets.】

item.title: 英特尔、三星业绩反弹因人工智能挑战而昙花一现
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）和三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co.【原文：Intel Corp. and Samsung Electronics Co. have collectively shed $227 billion in market value this year on their lack of leadership in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 中国工厂活动在刺激政策推动下意外扩张
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，尽管有为期一周的假期，中国上个月的制造业活动仍意外回升，这是在中国政府为支撑经济而推出刺激计划之后，中国经济企稳的又一迹象。【原文：China’s manufacturing activity unexpectedly picked up last month despite a week-long holiday, according to a private survey, a further sign of stabilization after Beijing unleashed a stimulus package to shore up the economy.】

item.title: 日本汽车制造商丰田和日产面临需求疲软和中国竞争
item.description: 丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.）和日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. and Nissan Motor Co. will offer clues on the outlook for Japan’s auto industry when they post earnings against a backdrop of faltering global demand, production cuts and intense competition.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德将总部迁至纽约以获得指数资格
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）将总部从多伦多迁至纽约，以接触更多的美国股票指数，吸引更多的投资者。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management moved its head office to New York from Toronto to gain access to more US stock indexes and attract more investors.】

item.title: 债券交易员从美国就业数据中寻找美联储降息计划的线索
item.description: 由于周五受飓风和罢工影响的美国就业报告为下周美联储政策决定提供了最后的线索，一直在对冲美国国债进一步下挫的投资者正准备迎接波动。【原文：Investors who’ve been hedging against a deeper selloff in US Treasuries are preparing for volatility as Friday’s hurricane- and strike-tinged US employment report offers final clues ahead of next week’s Federal Reserve policy decision.】

item.title: 打造机器人未来的国家
item.description:
在彭博社原创系列Momentum的这一集中，我们将了解日本如何将机器人技术作为一项产业和日常生活的一部分。【原文：

On this episode of the Bloomberg Originals series Momentum, we discover how Japan came to embrace robotics as both an industry and part of daily life.

】

item.title: 澳大利亚财富基金称通胀波动给加息之路蒙上阴影
item.description: 澳大利亚主权财富基金总裁表示，货币政策制定者和投资者正面临着应对动荡通胀的艰巨任务。【原文：The chief of Australia’s sovereign wealth fund said monetary policymakers and investors are facing a tough task navigating turbulent inflation.】

item.title: 巴菲特增持 Sirius XM，伯克希尔持股比例升至 33
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. continues adding to his stake in satellite-radio broadcaster Sirius XM Holdings Inc.】

item.title: 降息预期减弱，黄金从纪录跌落后趋于平稳
item.description: 由于交易商在接近历史最高水平时获利了结，以及强劲的美国数据削弱了进一步宽松货币政策的理由，黄金在创下7月以来最大单日跌幅后持稳。【原文：Gold was steady after its biggest one-day drop since July, as traders took profits near record-high levels and strong US data weakened the case for further monetary easing.】

item.title: 伊朗计划通过代理人袭击以色列的报道引发石油市场反弹
item.description: 有报道称，伊朗可能计划在未来几天内从伊拉克领土袭击以色列，这使市场的注意力重新回到中东的敌对行动上，石油连续第三个交易日延续涨势。【原文：Oil extended gains for a third session after a report that Iran could be planning to attack Israel from Iraqi territory in coming days, jolting the market’s attention back to Middle East hostilities.】

item.title: 中国黄金热的中心是一个昔日的渔村
item.description:
对贵金属的需求使购物者涌向深圳的珠宝中心。【原文：

Demand for the precious metal has shoppers flocking to a jewelry hub in Shenzhen.

】

item.title: 6 万亿美元外汇储备是亚洲抵御美元反弹的盾牌
item.description: 亚洲 6.4 万亿美元的外汇储备让投资者相信，各国央行有足够的弹药对抗美国总统大选带来的美元走强。【原文：A $6.4 trillion foreign-exchange reserve pile in Asia is giving investors confidence that central banks have the ammunition to fight the dollar’s strength stemming from the US presidential election.】

item.title: 日本股市将因日元升值和美国科技股下跌而下跌
item.description: 在隔夜日元对美元汇率上涨达 1%、美国科技股暴跌之后，日本股市可能会下跌。【原文：Japanese stocks will likely fall after the yen strengthened as much as 1% against the dollar overnight and US technology shares slumped.】

item.title: 美国就业数据公布前，科技股业绩下滑：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市因科技股业绩不佳而下跌后，亚洲股市将下滑。在周五晚些时候将公布美国就业数据之前，国债反弹有利于曲线的长端。【原文：Asian equities were set to slip after US stocks dropped on lackluster tech results. A rally in Treasuries favored the long end of the curve ahead of US jobs data due later Friday.】

item.title: 中国债券交易员正受到股票押注的挤压
item.description: 中国的债券价格正日益受到股市资金流动的影响，从固定收益市场到股票市场的抢购潮将两个市场的相关性推向四年多来的最高点。【原文：Bond prices in China are increasingly being influenced by stock market flows, with a rush from fixed-income to equities pushing the correlation between the two markets to its most extreme level in over four years.】

item.title: 高频交易员为日本股票多赚 30 分钟
item.description: 东京证券交易所增加 30 分钟的交易时间，可能会使一些投资者与算法驱动型基金形成对立，后者试图利用延长时间内发布的价格敏感公告。【原文：An additional 30 minutes of trading at the Tokyo Stock Exchange may pit some investors against algorithm-driven funds seeking to capitalize on price-sensitive announcements to be made during extended hours.】

item.title: 警方调查多伦多 GFL 环境工地枪战事件
item.description: 多伦多警方正在调查 GFL Environmental Inc.【原文：Police in Toronto are investigating shots fired at the offices of GFL Environmental Inc., the latest in a string of reports of gunfire targeting the waste management firm’s operations or personnel in the city.】

item.title: 蓝猫头鹰联席首席执行官划清公共和私营市场的界限
item.description: Blue Owl Capital Inc. 的联席首席执行官马克-利普舒尔茨（Marc Lipschultz）认为，尽管其他高管呼吁在这个价值 1.7 万亿美元的行业中增加流动性，并声称两者正在融合，但私人市场和公共市场之间仍有区别。【原文：There’s still a distinction between private and public markets, according to Blue Owl Capital Inc.’s co-chief executive officer, Marc Lipschultz, despite calls from other executives for more liquidity in the $1.7 trillion industry and a pitch that the two are converging.】

item.title: 业绩低于华尔街预期，币安股价创 2022 年以来最大跌幅
item.description: 美国最大的加密货币交易所 Coinbase Global Inc. 周三晚些时候公布的业绩低于华尔街预期，该公司股价创下两年多来最大跌幅。【原文：Shares of Coinbase Global Inc. fell the most in more than two years after the largest US crypto exchange posted results late Wednesday that were below Wall Street expectations.】

item.title: 苹果在华销售依然是本季度业绩的薄弱环节
item.description: 世界上最有价值的公司苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Apple Inc., the world’s most valuable company, reported weaker sales in China than anticipated last quarter, raising fresh concerns about one of its most important regions.】

item.title: 亚马逊预计假日购物季销售和利润强劲
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）预计本季度的利润和收入将超过分析师的预期，原因是人们对假日购物旺季持乐观态度。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. projected profit and revenue in the current quarter that exceeded analysts’ estimates on optimism for a strong holiday shopping season.】

item.title: 稳定币发行商 Tether 称第三季度利润为 25 亿美元
item.description: 英属维尔京群岛注册成立的最大稳定币运营商 Tether 控股有限公司表示，该公司第三季度实现净利润 25 亿美元，主要得益于持有美国国债和黄金所实现的收益。【原文：Tether Holdings Ltd., the British Virgin Islands-incorporated operator of the largest stablecoin, said it posted net profit of $2.5 billion in the third quarter, largely driven by gains realized on its holdings of US Treasuries and gold.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 获惠誉评级提升，首次获得投资评级
item.description: 拉丁美洲最有价值的公司 MercadoLibre 公司首次被提升为投资级，这对该电子商务公司来说是一个鼓舞，因为它正在努力争取整个地区的市场份额。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc., Latin America’s most valuable company, was upgraded to investment grade for the first time, a boost for the e-commerce company as it moves to gain market share across the region.】

item.title: 英特尔业绩引发扭亏为盈乐观情绪后大涨
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）发布的第四季度营收预期略高于预期，引发了市场对其有能力夺回部分失去的市场份额的乐观情绪。股价大涨。【原文：Intel Corp. gave a fourth-quarter revenue forecast slightly above estimates, sparking optimism that it’s capable of reclaiming some lost market share. Shares surged.】

item.title: 鲜为人知的 OpenAI 竞争对手正试图赢得全球南方市场
item.description:
G42的Inception公司在美国相对默默无闻，但它拥有大量的资金和筹码。【原文：

G42’s Inception is relatively unknown in the US, but it has access to a vast amount of capital and chips.

】

item.title: 星巴克首席执行官的 "可实现 "愿景引发华尔街谨慎乐观情绪
item.description: 星巴克公司新老板布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）的扭亏为盈演讲涉及从夏普到豆奶的方方面面，华尔街大多很喜欢他的演讲。【原文：The turnaround pitch from Starbucks Corp.’s new boss Brian Niccol touched on everything from Sharpies to soy milk, and Wall Street mostly liked what it saw.】

item.title: 里德-霍夫曼认为 2024 年大选的愤怒会扰乱硅谷
item.description: 亿万富翁、风险投资家里德-霍夫曼（Reid Hoffman）是卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）反对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）竞选活动的高调支持者。【原文：Billionaire venture capitalist Reid Hoffman, a high-profile supporter of Kamala Harris’s campaign against Donald Trump, said that division in Silicon Valley has interfered with business during the contentious 2024 election cycle.】

item.title: 电动飞机初创公司 Beta 新一轮融资 3.18 亿美元
item.description: 电动航空航天初创企业贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies Inc.【原文：Electric aerospace startup Beta Technologies Inc. raised $318 million from investors to fund the production of aircraft that can takeoff and land vertically.】
